name: Taha Tai Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice little hotel, which was perfectly adequate for our needs and was actually better than we expected. Rooms were decent size with colorful, cheery bedspreads and were very clean. Despite the tropical nature of the island we only saw a couple of very small bugs in our room during the entire 5 nights we were there. Maid service was very good. Some of the reception desk attendants were certainly friendlier than others. The location was very good, only about a 10 minute walk from the center of town. The breakfast buffet was limited but delicious, with wonderful pies every morning. We know hotel choices are limited on Easter Island, so for the price we paid we were happy with the Taha Tai and would recommend it.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel
Okay
reviews.text: We stayed at the Taha Tai for 4 nights. Dinner in the restaurant was expensive, but the continental breakfast buffet was very good. We had many choices and I very much enjoyed the cheese, although I'm not sure what type it was.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a short walk to town and very close to the ocean, although not to a beach. We did a great deal of walking and exploring on our own. One trip was to purchase an adaptor to recharge our video camera. The man working the front desk said he had an adaptor, but it was for his personal use and would not let us borrow it or even leave our camera with him at the desk for recharging.
reviews.title: Taha Tai okay

likes.liked: — Front desk staff were very nice.

reviews.text: The desk staff was nice enough to place reservations for a local dinner theatre for us. The rooms were kept clean. The air conditioning unit had trouble keeping the room cool during the day, but worked well enough at night.
reviews.title: Nice stay, good location in average hotel.

likes.liked: — comparatively good hotel on a very desolate island

reviews.text: I did try to contact this hotel after we made our reservations to check on things such as Internet service, but received no response to my e-mailed inquiries. There is a charge to use their Internet service in your room and you must have your own computer. They do not provide one nor do they have one available for use.
reviews.title: Taha Tai and Easter island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worrying about Rapa Nui is that many guests change accomodation upon arrival or after the first night. We have moved out from a Tripadvisor top rated neighboring place to this hotel after a terrible experience. We were lucky that one room was free as it was the last week-end of high season (the second Sunday in March) and overbooking seems to be common, by LAN and, as a consequence, by owners of accomodation.
reviews.title: Almost missed as underrated at Tripadvisor
The Best Moderately Priced Hotel on The Island
reviews.text: One lesson we have learnt is NOT to take Tripadvisor reviews in absolute terms: those are based on individual expectations which might diverge from a reviewer to the other. In our case, very personal attention like welcome kisses at the airport followed by detailed village tour with lots of recommendations and proposed excursions package is a nice to have if your room confirmed 6 months in advance in writing is actually available and you do not end up at the maid's room or on the street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This being said, the Taha Tai hotel saved our half-around-the-world-trip to Rapa Nui from a disaster. It was about the opposite of the previous place, no kisses, no questions where-from where-to, no payment requested for the whole stay upon arrival, but we moved in into a room about 4 times the size of the previous place, upon our request with a park view (see pictures).
reviews.title: Good Lcoation

reviews.text: It was quiet, lots of light, everything needed available and you felt safe for yourself and your belongings. Staff was helpful, especially a Japanese lady, rather keeping at distance, but efficient when being approached with a specific request.
reviews.title: good location and good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One evening, we had a meal there, which was fine, but we had a problem with the eggs served at breakfast. Only boiled eggs were fine, any kind of prepared ones had an unidentified taste.
reviews.title: Pleasant place to stay
